memberdef.name: ENSURE_PA
memberdef.initializer: do { \ PaError paErr; \ if( (paErr = (expr)) < paNoError ) \ { \ if( (paErr) == paUnanticipatedHostError && PaJack_IsOnMainThread() ) \ { \ const char *err = jackErr_; \ if (! err ) err = "unknown error"; \ PaUtil_SetLastHostErrorInfo( paJACK, -1, err ); \ } \ PaUtil_DebugPrint(( "Expression '" #expr "' failed in '" __FILE__ "', line: " STRINGIZE( __LINE__ ) "\n" )); \ result = paErr; \ goto error; \ } \ } while( 0 )

memberdef.name: UNLESS
memberdef.initializer: do { \ if( (expr) == 0 ) \ { \ if( (code) == paUnanticipatedHostError && PaJack_IsOnMainThread() ) \ { \ const char *err = jackErr_; \ if (!err) err = "unknown error"; \ PaUtil_SetLastHostErrorInfo( paJACK, -1, err ); \ } \ PaUtil_DebugPrint(( "Expression '" #expr "' failed in '" __FILE__ "', line: " STRINGIZE( __LINE__ ) "\n" )); \ result = (code); \ goto error; \ } \ } while( 0 )

memberdef.name: ASSERT_CALL
memberdef.initializer: do { \ int err = (expr); \ assert( err == success ); \ } while( 0 )

memberdef.argsstring: (struct PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *hostApi, const PaStreamParameters *inputParameters, const PaStreamParameters *outputParameters, double sampleRate)

memberdef.name: BlockingCallback

detaileddescription.para: Free resources associated with stream, and eventually stream itself.
Frees allocated memory, and closes opened pcms.

During Pa_Initialize, When PA JACK connects as a client of the JACK server, it requests a certain name, which is for instance prepended to port names. By default this name is "PortAudio". The JACK server may append a suffix to the client name, in order to avoid clashes among clients that try to connect with the same name (e.g., different PA JACK clients).

This function must be called before Pa_Initialize, otherwise it won't have any effect. Note that the string is not copied, but instead referenced directly, so it must not be freed for as long as PA might need it.
PaJack_GetClientName
Get the JACK client name used by PA JACK.
The caller is responsible for freeing the returned pointer.
